result.execSummary:
The defendant Brooke Emerson Rosas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (7th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine of $500.00, all court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA surcharge.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Balance to be paid by end of supervision.  Any amount remaiing due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax inte4cept or other means.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.
Defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse program after two (2) years confinement.

superMiscConds.notes:
No alcohol or drugs.
No possession, consumption, selling, distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.

Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
All applicable fees of supervision by the end of supervision.
AODA assessment.  Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute/maintain sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Defendant's operating privileges for operation of Class D vehicles is restricted to operating vehicles that are equipped with an ignition interlock device; and each motor vehicle for which the defendant's name appears on the vehicle's certificate of title or registration must be equipped with an ignition interlock device beginning on the date the department issues any license and for a period of three (3) years thereafter.
Court ordered Intoxicated Driver Assessment; form filed.   Copy to defendant.

Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never psosess a firearm; and that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt: Original PLEA AND SENTENCING Transcript (34 pages) commencing MAY 21, 2015 received and filed. kl

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Theresa R

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  8 YEARS with 92 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program but IS eligible for the WI Substance Abuse program after 2 YEARS confinement.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered Intoxicated Driver Assessment; form filed; copy to defendant.

Court ordered defendant's operating privileges revoked for 3 YEARS with the mandatory reinstatement fee.  

Defendant's operating privilege for operation of Class D vehicles is restricted to operating vehicles that are equipped with an ignition interlock device; and each motor vehicle for which the defendant's name appears on the vehicle's certificate of title or registration must be equipped with an ignition interlock device beginning on the date the department issues any license and for a period of  3 YEARS thereafter.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Fine in the amount of $500.00; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Letters in Support of the Defendant

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Brooke Emerson Rosas in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Brooke Emerson Rosas in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant Brooke Emerson Rosas not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brooke Emerson Rosas in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Brooke Emerson Rosas in custody.  Patrick J. Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug tests, portable breathalyzers and SCRAM.

Defendant Brooke Emerson Rosas in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Brooke Emerson Rosas in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
DEFENSE WAIVES TIME LIMITS.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
